results.title: Johnny Suede
results.creator_credit: Balthazar Pictures, Arena Films, Starr Pictures, Yoram Mandel, Ruth Waldburger and Tom Di Cillo
results.brief_description: An independent off-beat cult classic about an aspiring rock musician with a complicated love life and an obsession for suede and his own carefully cultivated self-image. Johnny (Brad Pitt) is a naive but endearing musician who models himself on the 1950s pop legend, Ricky Nelson. After a pair of black suede shoes fall on him from the sky one night, he adopts the name Johnny Suede and spends his time composing inspired love songs on his guitar that add greatly to the comic and somewhat bizarre quality of the film as he dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom. He meets the sensuous painter Yvonne (Catherine Keener) and begins a journey of self discovery that will never quite leave his carefully fabricated image the same again, or will it? Written and directed by Tom DiCillo, who followed this genuine and beautifully odd ball effort with ‘Living in Oblivion’(1994), said to be inspired in part by his experiences in making this film, and including a cast that features Nick Cave and Tina Louise. (Awards: Golden Leopard Award for Best Film, 1991)

results.title: Johnny Mnemonic
results.creator_credit: Don Carmody, ANM and Robert Longo
results.brief_description: A snapshot of the future, the year 2021. Corporations rule and the world is threatened by a new plague, NAS; Nerve Attenuation Syndrome. To protect data it must be smuggled through mnemonic carriers who carry the data through a computer chip implanted into the brain; Johnny Mnemonic (Keanu Reeves) is one such carrier. Johnny’s present mission is to carry data from two scientists who have defected from one of the world’s largest corporations, taking the information from Japan to America. The upload of information carried in Johnny’s brain surpasses anything he has carried before and he must find the secret access code that will allow him to download the information, otherwise he will die. Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi Kitano, Ice-T and Dina Meyer.

results.title: Johnny Guitar
results.creator_credit: Herbert J. Yates, Republic Entertainment International and Nicholas Ray
results.brief_description: A reformed gunfighter returns to a woman he had abandoned years earlier. She is now the proprietor of a gambling saloon opened in anticipation of the arrival of the railroad and in the face of hostile opposition from the local townspeople. The film’s bizarre, even baroque, intensity derives in part from the central antagonism between two women (virtually unique in the western), and in Yordan and Ray’s expressed intention of seeking an anti-McCarthy parable.

results.title: Johnny got his gun
results.brief_description: This is the ultimate anti-war film by writer/director Dalton Trumbo. The setting is World War I and a nameless, armless, legless, faceless hospitalised soldier is found to be conscious despite the extreme condition that his body remains in after an explosion. His isolation and freakish state causes unease and anguish to the viewer. The horror that he faces is broken up through the film with flashbacks of the soldiers life before the war. “Johnny Got his Gun” is a very important film which is both thought-provoking and distressing. Trumbo received the 1971 Fipresci Prize and was nominated for the Golden Palm at Cannes. Cast includes Timothy Bottoms, Jason Robards, Donald Sutherland, David Soul and Diane Varsi.

results.title: Johnny can learn to read
results.creator_credit: University of Guelph, Audio Visual Services and Courtney Milne
results.brief_description: Shows the Stott Programmed Reading Kit in use with children who have reading difficulties. The processes of learning to read are broken down into easy stages and each stage is built into a game or some other enjoyable activity.

results.title: John Turner, M.P.
results.brief_description: Work of an imaginary but typical member of Parliament for an English country constituency. At the house he welcomes constituents, discusses their problems and watches over their interests. On his constituency visits both he and his wife attend public functions; his advice and help and accessible to all, sometimes on issues affecting the whole community.

results.title: John Surtees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Motor-cycling champion John Surtees in action during different races, and off the track. Shows the strict routine and precision checking behind a race, several races, Surtees at work as an engineer and his family’s contribution to his success, and finally, his transfer to four-wheel (Formula 2) auto racing.

results.title: John Steinbeck: in rehearsal, 'Of mice and men'
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Andree Molyneux
results.brief_description: A group of actors meet together to rehearse, discuss and perform a dramatisation of Steinbeck’s “Of Mice and Men”. Also includes excerpts from the Hollywood screen version of the film.

results.title: John Raftery amateur boxer
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, Peter Katadotis and Steven Keller
results.brief_description: John Raftery, one of Canada’s boxing hopefuls for a gold medal at the Commonwealth Games at Edmonton in 1978 is seen training for the fight in his hometown and in the match for the gold medal at Edmonton
